references.paper_title: Near Shannon limit error-correcting coding and decoding: Turbo-codes
references.reason: This paper introduces turbo codes, a powerful error-correcting technique, which is conceptually relevant to the paper's reranking approach.
This seminal work on low-density parity-check codes, another important family of error-correcting codes, provides a relevant theoretical background for the paper's communication-theoretic approach.
This paper addresses the problem of multiple descriptions, a concept directly analogous to the generation of multiple hypotheses in LLMs, which is a core element of the paper's method.
This paper explores source-channel diversity techniques, which are highly relevant to the paper's approach that leverages redundancy in the generation process to improve reliability.
